How to Redeem Codes in Collect All Pets

Just like in most other Roblox games, entering codes in Collect All Pets is not particularly difficult. If players have any problems, though, this step-by-step guide on how to enter codes in Collect All Pets should make life much easier:

  • Open Roblox and launch Collect All Pets .
  • Find the blue tag icon on the main screen of the game.
  • Click on this icon.
  • Enter the offered code in the field that says "Enter Code."

Collect All Pets Tips and Tricks

Below, players can find tips and tricks for Collect All Pets :

  • Discover hidden eggs in different areas by using teamwork and creative jumping.
  • Use the index to track missing pets and strive to reach 240 discoveries.
  • Access the shop, enter codes, and manage settings and achievements.
  • Focus on hatching lower-tier pets to progress through mid-stages.
  • Maximize coin farming by joining powerful players in crystal farming for increased profits.

About the Collect All Pets Developer

Collect All Pets was created by a developer called TwoZoos. Although this was his first game, it became popular immediately. Therefore, players expect more new projects from him.

item.title: BioShock Doesn't Need a Genre Swap, But Could Benefit from One
item.description:
Highlights

  • BioShock series excels at immersive environments & gameplay, but a new open-world setting could take the series to the next level.
  • Helldivers 2's success shows that shaking up a winning formula can lead to massive viral success, a strategy BioShock 4 could consider.
  • Balancing scale and detail in an open-world setting for BioShock 4 will be a challenge, but with dedication, it could surpass its predecessors.

BioShock and its two subsequent sequels were some of the most important games of the seventh console generation. They were able to tell thought-provoking, theme-rich stories in an atmospheric setting, all the while providing an engaging gameplay experience that kept the whole thing still feeling fun. It was a winning formula back when the first game came out, and it’ll likely stay a winning formula whenever the long-rumored fourth BioShock game eventually hits the market.

Winning formulas can always be improved for the better. The original Helldivers was a traditional top-down shooter that had modest success. The sequel turned the series into a third-person action game and went on to massive viral success when it was released earlier this year. And even though the series has had massive success sticking with its past formula, the next BioShock game could do well following in Helldivers 2’s footsteps and shaking things up ever so slightly.

BioShock 4 Might Consider Going for an Open World

An Open World Can Highlight BioShock's Strong Settings

Whether Rapture or Columbia, BioShock has always had beautifully realized, richly detailed environments, but the level structure has always been relatively constrained. In all three games, the player is dropped into a vast, if slightly linear, chunk of the city and can only move on after completing whatever miscellaneous objective the narrative called for at the time. But the next entry in the franchise can shake things up by opening up larger chunks of the city at once.

Rapture and Columbia were both arguably the stars of their respective games, with so much of the developers’ care going into making those cities feel like real places, despite the fantasy elements inherent to them. There’s no better way to continue this series' trend of spotlighting the setting than to make it an open world, in something akin to the Far Cry series.

With how focused the BioShock games are on exploration, an open world just seems like the next logical step. Searching for hidden collectibles would be one of the best ways an open-world BioShock game could encourage players to get into the weeds of whatever dystopian city the series has on offer. Perhaps optionally collectible audio logs would be hidden over the map, as a means to encourage deeper exploration into the map and the environment – a strategy all three previous games have embraced to great effect.

Obviously, with a more traditional series like BioShock , there would need to be some barriers on where the player could go in the world and when they could get there. Perhaps certain chunks of the map are blocked off without access to a certain upgrade, or after they hit a certain story beat. Maybe a certain gun or an armor upgrade is needed to progress into a new part of the city – something to keep certain areas locked off and maintain a sense of progression throughout the game.

An Open World BioShock 4 Would Need to Be a Balancing Act Between Scale and Detail

As cool of an idea as an open-world BioShock would be, it would be an extremely ambitious undertaking for the developers. A huge part of the appeal of the original three games was the immense attention to detail in designing Rapture and Columbia; it was integral to the immersive nature of the games and made those cities feel like real, tangible places. While the freedom of an open world can also do wonders for the setting’s believability, it can also be a balancing act. Environments in open-world games usually aren’t as detailed or as intricate as a curated, traditional level would be. But with the right care and dedication, the developers can create an open-world environment that rivals the best levels of the original three games.

If the devs put in the time and the heart to create an open world that feels just as atmospheric and alive as its previous two settings, then there’s nothing stopping BioShock 4 from being the most immersive game in the series. And with the recent news that a new game in the series is already in development, players might get to juice up with plasmids again sooner than they think.

How to Redeem Codes in Driving Empire

Like with many other Roblox games, Driving Empire codes are available for everyone. To redeem them, players need only follow the straightforward steps below to claim their free rewards:

  1. Open Roblox and launch Driving Empire.
  2. Look in the bottom left corner and press the Settings button here.
  3. From here, go into the Codes tab and insert the code into the text box.
  4. Once done, press Submit and claim rewards.

Codes can only be redeemed once per account. That said, players can claim the same code on multiple accounts.

How to Play Driving Empire

Playing Driving Empire is very simple and fun. To begin with, after the player has appeared in the world, they'll need to choose a car. There are many real-world cars in the game and each of them has its own characteristics, but only two cars will be available at first. To earn money, players have to drive, drift, and participate in races. For the money earned, players can buy a new car or motorbike. With the Driving Empire codes in this article, Roblox players can buy new vehicles even faster.

The Best Roblox Racing Games Like Driving Empire

There are a lot of Roblox games with the theme of racing and cars in general, and among them are plenty of good ones that offer an interesting gaming experience. In this article, players will find the best games like Driving Empire :

  • Car Dealership Tycoon
  • Drive World
  • Southwest Florida
  • Vehicle Legends
  • Ultimate Driving

About the Driving Empire Developers

Driving Empire was created by a group of developers who call themselves Voldex. Although they have released one game so far, their Roblox group already has 2 million members.

item.title: Borderlands 3: How to Get the Breath of the Dying
item.description:
Dahl, the multi-conglomerate mercenary corporation, returns in Borderlands 3 to equip vault hunters with the best weapons money can buy. Featuring a long line of products, Dahl loyalists (and would-be adventurers joining after watching the Borderlands movie) will particularly be interested in the legendary Breath of the Dying assault rifle.

It shoots corrosive bullets with a zero percent status effect chance, meaning enemies will not be dealt a melt status effect. However, every kill with the assault rifle spawns a ring of 13 orbs that fly in all directions to deal corrosive splash damage. Perfect for Mayhem 10 mode, and especially designed to dominate in small enclosures, here is how to get the Breath of the Dying in Borderlands 3 .

The Breath of the Dying is part of the base game. You do not need to purchase any of the DLC packs for Borderlands 3 .

Best Way to Farm the Breath of the Dying in Borderlands 3

Breath of the Dying is part of the world drop pool, meaning that the legendary weapon has a small chance to drop from any dedicated loot source in Borderlands 3 . These sources include chests, vending machines, slot machines, challenges, enemies, etc.

Chances are that the weapon randomly drops for you while playing the game. If not, however, you will be glad to know that one particular enemy has a higher chance of dropping the Breath of the Dying than all the other loot sources.

Borderlands 3 has several items that increase your legendary drop chances. For example, the Shlooter artifact increases your legendary drop chances by a massive 2,000 percent on every kill. This buff, however, only lasts for 12 seconds.

As another example, the All-in shield has a 15 percent chance to drop a Luck Booster to boost your legendary chances by 1,000 percent for 15 seconds. Always equip them when farming for legendary drops.

The Blinding Banshee is a mini-boss that is an excellent legendary farming location for the Breath of the Dying in Borderlands 3 . She is a unique Mantakore that can be found on Nekrotafeyo. Head to the northern part of Desolation's Edge as marked on the map below to encounter her behind a small walled-off area. The closest fast travel points (encircled) are pretty far in the southeast and the westernmost parts of Desolation's Edge. Luckily, several Catch-a-Ride points are nearby to help you traverse the terrain faster.

The Blinding Banshee has a 10% chance of dropping the legendary Breath of the Dying assault rifle in Borderlands 3 . She can also drop the legendary Red Queen grenade mod and the unique Shrieking Devil shotgun, which are equally excellent to equip for your vault hunter's overpowered build. Note that the Blinding Banshee is a respawnable boss. You will be farming her a lot of times to get all of her legendary drops.

Choose your elements carefully. Refrain from using the Breath of the Dying on frozen enemies because their hit-boxes cause the orbs to immediately explode.
